Parent Company: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
Description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced that ICBC Standard Bank Plc would pay $4.2 million to settle allegations relating to the failure to disclose certain payments in connection with debt issued by the Government of Tanzania in 2013.

Company: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Financial Services LLC
Parent Company: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China
Description: The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority fined Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Financial Services LLC $5.3 million for systemic anti-money laundering compliance failures, including its failure to have a reasonable AML program in place to monitor and detect suspicious transactions, as well as other violations, including financial, recordkeeping, and operational violations.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.
